banner.mainContentHeadline: The podcast where science meets business
banner.mainContent: From fixing meetings to finding a mentor, get new insights to help you enjoy your time at work and thrive in your career.

videoData.title: "Miles from Any Shoreline"

recommendations.blurb: More resources curated by Sarah Kay recommends.

takeAction.blurb: **Learn more** about Project VOICE's work to bring poetry into education spaces and communities worldwide.

nodes.whoTheyAre: Sarah Kay is a writer, performer and educator from New York City.
nodes.whyListen: Sarah Kay has shared her poems in cornfields in Iowa, an orthodontist's office in Nepal, a ship on a fjord in Norway, a nightclub in Singapore, the Royal Danish Theatre in Denmark, Carnegie Hall in New York City, the Kennedy Center in Washington, DC, the back rooms of dive-bars, middle school gymnasiums and once on top of someone's dining room table. She was the 2022 New Arizona Fellow at New America and is the author of four books of poetry: No Matter the Wreckage, B, The Type and All Our Wild Wonder. Kay is the founder and co-director of Project VOICE, an organization that uses poetry to entertain, educate and inspire students and teachers worldwide.

videoData.description: Sarah Kay shares "Miles from Any Shoreline," a poem about "wandering the streets of Bewilderville" and "picking up when the universe calls."
videoData.socialDescription: Sarah Kay shares "Miles from Any Shoreline," a poem about "wandering the streets of Bewilderville" and "picking up when the universe calls."
